variables.desc: Codemasters, founded in 1986, is a British video game developer and publisher known for its racing game franchises, including "Colin McRae Rally," "TOCA," and "F1." They also developed a variety of other genres, such as the "Dizzy" series in their early years. Codemasters is recognized for its technical expertise in creating realistic and immersive racing experiences, and has been a significant player in the video game industry for decades.
